alert.note: Alert for Summit (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 16 at 11:51AM EST until February 20 at 12:01AM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Cleveland OH has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Ohio... Cuyahoga River At Independence affecting Cuyahoga County. Cuyahoga River At Old Portage affecting Summit County. Killbuck Creek Near Killbuck affecting Holmes and Wayne Counties. Mahoning River At Warren affecting Trumbull County. Mahoning River At Leavittsburg affecting Trumbull County. Mahoning River At Youngstown affecting Mahoning and Trumbull Counties. For the Cuyahoga River...including Old Portage, Independence...Major flooding is forecast. For the Killbuck Creek...including Killbuck...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Mahoning River...including Leavittsburg, Warren, Youngstown...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING TO EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Cuyahoga River At Old Portage. * WHEN...From Friday morning to early Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Facilities at the Akron Water Treatment and Pollution Control Plant are impacted. Water inundates low lying park land adjacent to the river. Low lying roads adjacent to the river will be threatened. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 4.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Friday morning to a crest of 12.8 feet Friday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 10.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.8 feet on 05/13/2014. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening by 945 PM EST.
